results.title: Tender loving care
results.creator_credit: David Wheeler, Rob Landeros and Aftermath Media
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Andrew Neiderman and directed by David Wheeler, “Tender loving care” is an interactive movie where the viewer’s involvement can alter the outcome. The story revolves around the Overton couple who are suffering the trauma of a personal tragedy. When a psychiatric nurse comes to their aid, all sorts of mysteries and secrets begin to unfold. In between scenes the view is given thematic apperception tests about the characters and also personal views and interpretations. Clues are also discovered by navigating through the 3D environments or certain parts in the film. Guided by Doctor Turner (John Hurt), your journey through “Tender Loving Care” is a psychological experience that changes each time you play. Cast includes Michael Esposito, Beth Tegarden and Marie Caldare.

results.title: Tender is the night
results.brief_description: This lavish production of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s “Tender is the Night” is set against the sumptuous background of the playgrounds of Europe during the 1920s. Dick Diver, a brilliant young American psychiatrist, falls in love with Nicole Warren, a beautiful but schizophrenic American heiress. They make a stylish, glamorous couple and in the carnival atmosphere of the 1920s enjoy a lavish lifestyle on the French Riviera, in Paris and in Switzerland. This brings them a fascinating circle of friends, but rivalries and conflicting passions within the group strain their relationship and take a heavy toll on Nicole’s fragile health. For Dick, the intertwining of lives with Nicole ends in tragedy. Screenplay by Dennis Potter.

results.title: Tender hooks
results.creator_credit: Mary Callaghan, Chris Oliver and Tru-Vu Pictures
results.brief_description: Mitch’s career as a hairdresser is nearing an end, but she remains optimistic and energetic. She meets Rex, charismatic, homeless and involved in schemes that result in his imprisonment. Mitch’s love for Rex survives his stay in prison, but when he escapes from custody, she is forced to confront the reality of their relationship and assume responsibility for her own future. Cinematography by Ray Argall. Cast includes Jo Kennedy, Nique Needles, Anna Phillips, Robert Menzies and John Polson.

results.title: Tenants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place of Your Own”.
The rental market is seen as the traditional first step for young people leaving home. This tape looks at the situation for three young people

results.title: Ten years of Countdown
results.brief_description: The first ten years of Countdown coincided with, and was part of, an incredible growth in the Australian music scene. The emergence of a wealth of new talent, highlighted by Countdown appearances, is represented by the performances which includes Skyhooks, AC/DC, Australian Crawl, Split Enz, Inxs, Mondo Rock, Renee Geyer, Richard Clapton, Ted Mulray Gang and others.

results.title: Ten years of co-op credit
results.creator_credit: Walter Scott and United States. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of rural production credit associations in the US during World War 2. These associations were set up by farmers to help each other and themselves through the depression years; in 1943 they were helping to boost agricultural production as part of the national war effort of the US during WW2.

results.title: Ten years in an open necked shirt
results.creator_credit: Nick May, Peter Berry, Elizabeth Taylor-Mead, Channel Four, Arts Council of Great Britain and Metropolis Pictures
results.brief_description: John Cooper Clarke - poet, storyteller, comic, is the central figure of the contemporary British revival of popular poetry. This program which mixes concert footage and interviews with interpreted and dramatised treatments of his work, shows him to be as engaging and extraordinary as the imagery of his poetry.

results.title: Ten years after...ten years older
results.creator_credit: Anna Kannava and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: After a ten year absence, the filmmaker returns to her beloved country of birth - Cyprus. This film is about a return to origins, memory, expectations and realisations. 1987 ATOM Award finalist.

results.title: Ten times empty
results.creator_credit: I Wilson, J Tristram and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: A study of life in a Greek village community on the island of Simi, a barren rocky island lying in the Aegean Sea off the coast of Turkey, with particular emphasis on the surrendering of traditional means of livelihood because of changing economic circumstances. Migration is a central theme of the film, with special reference to Australia. Scenes of the island reveal that despite a lack of factories, farming and jobs, close cultural and community ties bind the 3,000 inhabitants together.
